Speech Peter Praet:  The economic situation in the euro area and the implications for monetary policy https://t.co/APOXrrK7CP
Speech Sabine Lautenschläger: Digital na(t)ive? Fintechs and the future of banking https://t.co/vtMf0LmZEa
Lautenschläger: It is not our job to decide about the structure of the banking system. But banks' business models need to be viable.
Nouy: We are well equipped to deal with big banks
Nouy: We need consolidation of the banking system. Of course we need to take into account the too big to fail issue.
Nouy: Reduction of risk and increasing solidarity should go hand in hand
Introductory statements Danièle Nouy and Sabine Lautenschläger to banking supervision press conference https://t.co/lH03YA9pCG
Lautenschläger: We will only grant licenses to well capitalised, well managed banks relocating to euro area. There will be no race to bottom
Lautenschläger: EC proposals to adapt banking rules in line with global standards, idea of banking union and principle of proportionality
Lautenschläger: We need a global approach to regulation. That’s why we have to finalise the Basel III reforms as quickly as possible.
Nouy: Banking is not only about stability, but also about profitability. Banks need to embrace change and adjust business models.
Nouy: Internal models are a good management tool, but outcomes need to be consistent and comparable
Nouy: Banks need realistic, ambitious strategies to tackle NPLs. National lawmakers also need to act to remove obstacles.
Nouy: NPLs remain key priority for ECB Banking Supervision. NPLs weigh on profits and ability of banks to serve economy.
